title: famine
comment: A severe long-term absence of food, leading to disaster for the people affected in this way. Scripture provides examples of such famines, while also indicating the possibility and dangers of spiritual famine arising through disobedience or lack of faith.

children.title: famine, physical
children.comment: A serious shortage of food caused by drought, war or natural disasters. Famine is seen as a sign of God's judgment on Israel.

children.title: In the days of the prophets
God's people seek him and return to him
famine, spiritual
children.comment: A state of spiritual hunger arising from a failure to experience the presence and joy of God. Scripture describes such experiences, indicates one ultimate cause to be unbelief and points to ways in which this famine can be relieved.

primaryrefs.comment: It is possible to be well-fed physically but famished spiritually.

children.title: Relief is promised to God's people
Final relief is found in heaven
Conditions of relief from spiritual famine
It is for those who desire it
It is for those who pray
It is for those who repent
It is for those who have patience
